scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder comprises letters to John Wesley Hunt, Richard Higgins' receipt for shares of stock on the Bank of the United States, and a promissory note to Colonel James Johnson for $3150 from John W. Hunt. Letters to John W. Hunt of Lexington, Kentucky, discuss a lawsuit by Hunt against Charles L. Carson, the Bank of the United States, goods delivered, Winter and McCall's new firm, commissions, and his daughter's health. Richard Higgins paid $3,830.94 for ten shares of stock in his own name and 203 shares as the attorney for an included list of buyers.
